title: Bug 49195: Error message printed when using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service
description:
When specifying <Server port="1" in server.xml3, the following error message is printed in catalina.20100427.log: 
"27.04.2010 17:49:13 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina stopServerSEVERE: No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down." 
However, despite this message, Tomcat actually stops. When the service launcher stops Tomcat, Catalinaserver is not null.
OB: When using 1 as shutdown port with the Windows service, an error message is printed in the catalina.20100427.log file saying "No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down." However, Tomcat actually stops despite this message.
EB: To improve upon this behavior, it would be better to use the wait(10000) method instead of sleep(10000) in StandardServer.await(). This would allow the method to be woken up by a notifyAll() call or use the interrupt() method to wake it up if we know the thread.
SR: To reproduce the issue, specify <Server port="1" in the server.xml3 file and observe the error message in the catalina.20100427.log file. Note that despite the error message, Tomcat should still stop.
